column1: Puente Genil (Spanish pronunciation: [ˈpwente xeˈnil]) is a Spanish city in the province of Córdoba
column2: autonomous community of Andalusia. It is situated about 45 miles (70 km) from the provincial capital
column3: Córdoba. It has a population of around 30

column1: The name of the town comes from the bridge over the river Genil.
The town is an agricultural centre
column2: also known for its Semana Santa celebration
column3: contracted in the local vernacular to "mananta".

column1: Puente Genil is served by Puente Genil-Herrera railway station
column2: around 4 km from the town centre on the AVE high-speed rail line from Madrid to Málaga.
